ranked_diseases.explanation: KBG syndrome is associated with phenotypic features such as macrodontia, short stature, abnormalities of the hand, and delayed skeletal maturation; all features present in the patient. Similar reference cases diagnosed as KBG syndrome further support this as the most likely diagnosis.
Russell-Silver syndrome can present with short stature and delayed skeletal maturation. Although macrodontia is not a typical feature, genetic heterogeneity implies some variability in presentation.
Robinow syndrome can include short stature and hand abnormalities, but the presence of macrodontia and delayed skeletal maturation is less typical.
